page.title: 03HOME LIFE in Blindcrake
page.content: Families tend to be interdependent for example: they share child-care, lifts into Cockermouth and heavy lifting jobs (pianos, boilers, etc.) Tools and experience are also shared as houses are modernised (mostly Do- It-Yourself improvements). Due perhaps to Blindcrake's relative isolation, children play happily together despite some wide gaps in age. Ages range from two new babies to teenages with most between 5 to 11 years old. Food is purchased in nearby towns or from the several mobile shops that visit each week. Supplementing these are locally produced fruit, vegetables eggs, honey, etc.. Food is cooked and homes heated with solid fuel (coal and wood), oil, electricity or bottled gas. Thre is no mains gas supply.
